page.title: 04SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content:
Local inhabitants are most concerned in 1985 about the possibility of motorway being built through the area. This will be the M40 link from Waterstock to Birmingham.
Finding employment in this area can be a problem. People not directly involved with farming must go elsewhere to find work, usually to Oxford, Aylesbury or High Wycombe, and many people commute to London.
Property in this area is very expensive. In the villages only rarely is property available at less than 40,000 pounds. Thus, young people tend to leave the area, initially for employment and later for accommodation.
